protocol.name: Plan-Act-Verify
protocol.description: Structured approach for multi-step tasks requiring validation at each phase. Breaks complex tasks into testable chunks with explicit success criteria.

steps.description: Break task into discrete, testable steps with clear success criteria
procedure: Define success criteria for each step
steps.validation: Each step has clear, measurable success criteria and all dependencies identified

steps.description: Execute steps sequentially, validating each before proceeding to next
procedure: Execute one step at a time
Check success criteria after each step
steps.validation: All steps executed in order and each validated before proceeding

steps.description: Check overall task completion against original goals and criteria
procedure: Document what worked and what didn't
steps.validation: All original success criteria evaluated and confidence score computed

expert_excerpt.description: When executing a step, ensure it has testable outcomes and validate before proceeding
key_points: Every step must have measurable success criteria
Validate each step before moving to next
Document what works and what doesn't
Pause and reassess if validation fails

advantages: Partial results still useful if interrupted
limitations: May feel rigid for creative work

examples.task: Create a data analysis report from CSV file
examples.expected_approach: Plan: [Load data, Validate structure, Clean data, Analyze patterns, Create visualizations, Write report]. Act: Execute each step with validation (e.g., after 'Validate structure', confirm no critical errors before proceeding to 'Clean data'). Verify: Check report completeness against requirements.

Plan: [Reproduce error, Identify root cause, Design fix, Implement fix, Test fix, Deploy]. Act: Validate each step (e.g., 'Reproduce error' must show consistent reproduction before moving to 'Identify root cause'). Verify: Confirm error no longer occurs and no regressions.
